ACLAME.description: (A CLAssification of Mobile genetic Elements) A database dedicated to the collection and classification of mobile genetic elements (MGEs) from various sources, comprising all known phage genomes, plasmids and transposons. In addition to providing information on full genomes and genetic entities, it aims at building a comprehensive classification of the functional modules of MGE's at the protein, gene, and higher levels.

ALE.description: A probabilistic framework for determining the likelihood of a genome or metagenome assembly using bayesian statistics. It allows for comparisons between multiple assemblies generated from the same set of reads

ARAGORN.description: tRNA and tmRNA finder. ARAGORN is highly specialized at finding all tRNAs and tmRNAs in a DNA sequence.

Archaeopteryx.description: Tool for the visualizition, analysis, and editing of potentially large and highly annotated phylogenetic trees

BBTools.description: Suite of fast, multithreaded bioinformatics tools designed for analysis of DNA and RNA sequence data. BBTools can handle common sequencing file formats such as fastq, fasta, sam, scarf, fasta+qual, compressed or raw, with autodetection of quality encoding and interleaving.

BCFtools.description: Set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart (BCF)

BEAR.description: (Better Emulation for Artificial Reads) A collection of scripts for generating simulated WGS metagenomic reads with read lengths, quality scores, error profiles, and species abundances derived from real user-supplied WGS data.

BEDTools.description: (Browser Extensible Data tools) Set of tools for performing a wide-range of genomics analysis tasks using the BAM, BED, GFF, and VCF file formats

BLAST+.description: (Basic Local Alignment Search Tool) Finds regions of local similarity between sequences. The program compares nucleotide or protein sequences to sequence databases and calculates the statistical significance of matches.

BWA.description: (Burrows-Wheeler Aligner) For mapping low-divergent sequences against a large reference genome

BacMet.description: A bioinformatics resource of antibacterial biocide- and metal-resistance genes consisting of a database of manually curated, experimentally confirmed resistance genes and a database of predicted resistance genes based on sequence similarity

Barrnap.description: rRNA finder. Barrnap is highly specialized at finding bacterial 5S, 23S, 16S rRNA genes; archaea 5S, 5.8S, 23S, 16S rRNA genes; and eukaryotic 5S, 5.8S, 28S, 18S rRNA genes.

BinSanity.description: An Affinity Propogation based binner capable of using various datato both generate and refine bins.

Biopython.description: Python module containing many useful functions for common bioinformatics tasks

BowTie2.description: Tool for aligning sequence reads to long reference sequences. It is optimized for the read lengths and error modes yielded by recent sequencing technologies

CARD.description: (Comprehensive Antibiotic Resistance Database) A database of resistance genes, their products and associated phenotypes. CARD provides curated reference sequences and SNPs organized via the Antibiotic Resistance Ontology, which are additionally associated with detection models, in the form of curated homology cut-offs and SNP maps, for prediction of resistome from molecular sequences.

CD-Hit.description: A suite of tools for aligning and clustering proteins, creating OTUs from 16S rRNA, filtering duplicated reads from sequencers, and merging assembled contigs.

CDB.description: (Constant DataBase) A set of indexing and retrieval tools for FASTA files.

CRISPRDetect.description: A tool to discover and explore CRISPR non-coding RNAs in sequence data.

CRT.description: (CRISPR Recognition Tool) A tool for the detection of clustered regularly interspaced palindromic repeats.

CheckM.description: Toolset for assessing the quality of putative genomes. Makes use of metrics like ubiquitous single copy gene number, GC content, and coding density

Clustal-Omega.description: A general purpose multiple alignment program for DNA or proteins.

Clustal-W.description: Interactive multiple alignment of nucleic acid and protein sequences.

Cutadapt.description: Finds and removes adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and other types of unwanted sequence from high-throughput sequencing reads

DADA2.description: For inferring sample composition from aplicon sequencing reads. Can resolve differences of as little as a single nucleotide

DBC.description: (Distribution-Based Clustering) Clusters 16s tag-sequences using distribution information to inform OTU generation

DESeq2.description: R package for estimating variance-mean dependence in count data from high-throughput sequencing assays and test for differential expression based on a model using the negative binomial distribution

DIAMOND.description: A sequence aligner for protein and translated DNA searches, designed for high performance analysis of big sequence data.

DISCO.description: (Distributed Co-assembly of Overlap graphs) Multi-threaded and multi-process distributed memory overlap-layout-consensus (OLC) metagenome assembler capable of assembling various types of Illumina reads. Disco requires proper trimming, filtering and error correction of the raw Illumina reads before  assembly.

DRISEE.description: (Duplicate Read Inferred Sequencing Error Estimation) A tool that utilizes artifactual duplicate reads (ADRs) to provide a platform independent assessment of sequencing error in metagenomic (or genomic) sequencing data.

EMBOSS.description: A comprehensive set of sequence analysis programs and core software libraries.

EMIRGE.description: (Expectation-Maximization Iterative Reconstruction of Genes from the Environment) Reconstructs full-length ribosomal genes from short read sequencing data

ESOM.description: (Emergent Self-Organizing Maps) Suite of programs to perform data mining (clustering, visualization, classification) tasks

FOAM.description: (Functional Ontology Assignments for Metagenomes) A functional gene database for screening environmental metagenomic sequence datasets. FOAM provides a functional ontology dedicated to classifying gene functions relevant to environmental microorganisms based on Hidden Markov Models (HMMs).

FastQC.description: Generates comprehensive quality control reports on sequence data in FastQ, SAM, or BAM formats. It can be run in an interactive graphical mode or command-line batch mode

FastTree.description: Infers approximately-maximum-liklihood phylogenetic trees from alignments of nucleotide or protein sequences

FragGeneScan.description: For finding (fragmented) genes in short reads. It can also be applied to predict prokaryotic genes in incomplete assemblies or complete genomes

FreeBayes.description: A Bayesian genetic variant detector. Designed to find small polymorphisms, specifically single-nucleotide polymorphisms, indels (insertions and deletions), multi-nucleotide polymorphisms, and complex events (composite insertion and deletion events)

GraPhlAn.description: For producing high-quality circular representations of phylogenetic or taxonomic trees

Grinder.description: A versatile program for creating random shotgun and amplicon sequence libraries based on DNA, RNA or protein reference sequences provided in a FASTA file

GyDB.description: (Gypsy Database) A non-redundant database of manually refined multiple alignments, hidden markov model profiles, and majority-rule consensus sequences based on all currently known protein domains of the distinct mobile genetic elements and related host genes classified at GyDB.

HMMER3.description: (Hidden Markov ModlER) A suite of tools for creating, using, and analyzing Hidden Markov Models in a biological context. HMMER3 can be used with both proteins and nucleotides to model sequences, align sequences, and determine the probability of alignment.

HTSeq.description: Python package providing a framework for processing high-throughput sequencing data

HumanN2.description: A pipeline for profiling the metabolic pathways in a microbial community from metagenomic or metatranscriptomic sequencing data

IDBA.description: (Iterative De-Bruijn Graph Assembler) Assemblers for short sequencing reads. IDBA-UD  is for de novo assembly of reads with highly uneven sequencing depth, such as in metagenomics and single-cell genomics data. IDBA-Tran is for assembly of trasncritpome data. IDBA-Hybrid is for assembly of genomics data using a reference genome.

Infernal.description: (INFERence of RNA ALignment) Suite of programs for structural RNA alignment and database homology search.

IntegronFinder.description: Detects integrons in DNA sequences by finding particular features of the integron: the attC sites, the integrase, and when possible attI site and promoters.

InterProScan.description: A protein profiling pipeline from the European Bioinformatics Institute that analyzes FASTA files for proteins, domains, etc. from over a dozen databases and consolidates the output.

Jellyfish.description: A tool for fast, memory-efficient counting of k-mers in DNA

KEGG.description: (Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes) a database resource for understanding high-level functions and utilities of the biological system, such as the cell, the organism and the ecosystem, from molecular-level information, especially large-scale molecular datasets generated by genome sequencing and other high-throughput experimental technologies.

Khmer.description: Library and toolkit for doing k-mer-based dataset analysis and transformations. The type of transformations include inexact transformations- for abundance filtering and error trimming - and exact transformations - for graph-size filtering, to remove disconnected reads; and partitioning, to  split reads into disjointed sets

KronaTools.description: Tools for creating krona charts (HTML5 pie charts) from hierarchical data generated from several bioinformatics tools or manually as text and XML files

LAP.description: (Log Average Probability) Provides a de novo probabilistic measure of assembly quality. It allows for comparisons between multiple assemblies generated from the same set of reads.

LAST.description: Large-scale alignment program. LAST is an aligner like BLAST but is better at finding weak alignments and alignments in repeat-rich sequences

LotuS.description: (Less OTU Scripts) Pipeline for calculating denoised and chimera-checked OTUs from multiplexed, next generation tag-sequencing data

MEGAHIT.description: A Next Generation Sequencing de Bruijn de novo assembler. Can use GPU and is very memory efficient.

MOCAT.description: Pipeline for processing Illumina metagenomic data

MUMmer.description: Ultra-fast whole genome aligner. Works for drafts or complete assemblies from cultures or metagenomics.

MUSCLE.description: For creating multiple alignments of protein sequences

MatGAT.description: (Matrix Global Alignment Tool) Calculates the similarity and identity between every pair of DNA or protein sequences in a given data set without needing pre-alignment of data

MaxBin.description: For binning assembled metagenomics sequences based on an Expectation-Maximization algorithm. Combines tetranucleotide frequencies and contig/scaffold coverages to organize metagenomic sequences into individual bins, which are predicted from initial identification of marker genes in assembled sequences

Mesquite.description: Designed to help organize and analyze comparative data about organisms, with an emphasis on phylogenetic analysis

MetaBAT.description: (Metagenome Binning with Abundance and Tetra-nucleotide frequencies) Fully automated tool for grouping large genomic fragments assembled from shotgun metagenomic sequences. MetaBAT integrates empirical probabilistic distances of genome abundance and tetranucleotide frequency for accurate binning

MetaCyc.description: A curated database of experimentally elucidated metabolic pathways from all domains of life. MetaCyc contains 2491 pathways from 2816 different organisms.

MetaGeneMark.description: Finds Genes/ORFs in DNA sequences as short as 400 nucleotides using Hidden Markov Models.

MetaPhlAn.description: (Metagenomic Phylogenetic Analysis) A microbial community profiler. Attemps to determine number of cells of each taxa in a sample.

MetaVelvet.description: Like velvet, but modified for the assembly of metagenomes

MetaWatt.description: A GUI binner that constructs bins using tetranucleotide frequency, differential coverage, and read mapping data. Performs quality control using blastx, HMMER, and ARAGORN

MetacodeR.description: R package for parsing taxonomic data and visualizing taxonomic diversity in a way that provides taxonomic context

MinCED.description: (Mining Clustered Regulary Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats (CRISPRs) in Environmental Datasets) Finds CRISPRs in full genomes or environmental datasets, in which sequence size can be between 100 to 800 bp

MinPath.description: A parsimony approach for biological pathway reconstructions using protein family predictions

Moira.description: For quality-based filtering of sequencing reads. Calculates error-probability distributions from quality scores to determine the number of errors expected in the sequence

Mothur.description: Suite of tools for analyzing sequencing data from environmental samples

Nonpareil.description: Uses redundancy of reads in metagenomic datasets to estimate average coverage and predict the sequencing effort required to achieve nearly complete coverage

ORFfinder.description: Searches for open reading frames (ORFs) in DNA sequences.

Oligotyping.description: For identifying subtle variation among 16S Ribosomal RNA gene sequences to reveal diversity at an extremely precise level within closely-related organisms

Omega.description: An overlap-graph based, de novo metagenome assembler. Omega works best with long Illumina reads and datasets with deep coverage

PANDAseq.description: Assembles overlapping paired-end Ilumina reads into sequences

PEAR.description: (Paired-End reAd mergeR) Fast and accurate merger for Ilumina paired-ends read. It can handle large datasets and is capable of dealing with reads that are longer than the template.

PILER.description: For analyzing repetitive DNA found in genome sequences.

PILER-CR.description: For the identification and analysis of CRISPR repeats.

PRINSEQ.description: (PReprocessing & INformation of SEQuence data) Tool for filtering, reformatting, and trimming genomic and metagenomics sequencing data

Pfam.description: A database with a large collection of protein families, each represented by multiple sequence alignments and hidden Markov models (HMMs).

PhylOTU.description: Identifies microbial OTUs from metagenomic sequence data

PhyloPhyiaS+.description: A composition-based taxonomic binning method for metagenomic samples. It uses marker gene data to determine which clades to model and what sample-derived data to use

PhyloSeq.description: R package that provides a set of classes to facilitate the import, storage, analysis, and graphical display of microbiome census data

PhyloSift.description: Tools for conducting phylogenetic analysis of genomes and metagenomes

Picard.description: Tools for manipulating high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data and formats such as SAM/BAM/CRAM and VCF

Prodigal.description: (PROkaryotic DYnamic Programming Genefinding ALgorithm) A fast and accurate protein encoding gene predictor for prokaryotic genomes. Uses dynamic programming to reduce false-positive gene calls in organisms with high GC content

Prokka.description: (Prokaryotic annotation) For rapid prokaryotic genome annotations

QIIME.description: (Quantitative Insights into Microbial Ecology) Suite of tools for the comparison and analysis of microbial communities

QUAST.description: (Quality Assessment Tool for Genome Assemblies) Tools for evaluating genome and metagenome assemblies through the computation of various metrics. Also includes a genome visualizer for accurate assessment and analysis of genomic drafts when used with reference genomes

RAxML.description: (Randomized Axelerated Maximum Liklihood) Performs maximum-liklihood based inference on large phylogenetic trees

REAPR.description: Tool for evaluating the accuracy of an assembly using mapped paired-end reads

RGI.description: (Resistance Gene Identifier) For detecting antimicrobial resistance gene and mutation sequences in genome or protein sequences. It catalogs resistome predictions by both drug class and resistance mechanism using the Antibiotic Resistance Ontology (ARO)

Ray.description: Uses distributed computing for de novo assembly of very large next-generation sequencing datasets. Can assemble single genomes, metagenomes, and metatranscriptomes, and contains functionality for taxonomic and gene ontology profiling

RefSeq.description: An annotated, curated, non-redundant, and comprehensive database of assembled genomes built by NCBI.

ResFams.description: A curated database of protein families and associated profile hidden Markov models (HMMs), confirmed for antibiotic resistance function and organized by ontology. ResFams is composed of a core database, trained using unique antibiotic resitance proteins from several high quality AMR databases, and a full database supplemented with additional profile HMMs from the Pfam and TIGRFAMs databases, which have been curated and demonstrated to identify protein families that commonly contribute to resistance, including acetyltransferases, transcriptional regulators, etc.

Rfam.description: A database of structure-annotated multiple sequence alignments, covariance models and family annotation for a number of non-coding RNA, cis-regulatory and self-splicing intron families.

SAMtools.description: (Sequence Alignment/Map tools) Tools for manipulating alignments in the SAM, BAM, and CRAM formats

SDM.description: (Simple Demultiplexer) General purpose tool used for the demultiplexing, quality filtering, and format conversion of sequencing data

SHRiMP.description: (SHort Read Mapping Package) Aligns Next-Generation Sequencing reads to a reference genome using the q-gram filtering technique and Smith-Waterman string matching algorithm

SILVA.description: A comprehensive, quality checked database of aligned small (16S/18S, SSU) and large subunit (23S/28S, LSU) ribosomal RNA (rRNA) sequences for all three domains of life.

SPAdes.description: An assembly toolkit containing various assembly pipelines, including for metagenomic data sets, highly polymorphic diploid genomes, plasmids from WGS data sets, and RNA-Seq data

SRA-toolkit.description: Enables reading ('dumping') of sequencing files from the SRA database and writing ('loading') files into the .sra format

SWARM.description: single-linkage clustering method for amplicon-based studies that uses sequence abundance to delineate OTUs

Scythe.description: Uses Bayesian statistics and quality score information to determine if a read contains a contaminant substring

ShortBRED.description: (Short, Better, Representative Extract Dataset) A pipeline for identifying unique markers in protein families and searching for the identified markers in metagenomes

SourceTracker.description: A Bayesian approach for estimating the proportion of contaminants in a given community that come from possible source environments

SourceTracker2.description: A Bayesian approach for estimating the proportion of contaminants in a given community that come from possible source environments. SourceTracker2 extends the functionality of the original R package

TIGRFAMs.description: A collection of protein families, featuring curated multiple sequence alignments, hidden Markov models (HMMs) and annotation, which provides a tool for identifying functionally related proteins based on sequence homology.

TagDust.description: Identifies and eliminates artifactual sequences in NGS datasets

Traitar.description: For phenotyping bacteria using nucleotide or protein sequences. It has models for predicting 67 traits such as the use of different substrates as carbon and energy sources, oxygen requirement, morphology, and antibiotic susceptibility.

Trimmomatic.description: A flexible trimmer for Illumina paired-end and single-end data

USEARCH.description: Tool for processing high-throughput sequencing data

UniProt.description: A comprehensive, high-quality and freely accessible resource of protein sequence and functional information.

VSEARCH.description: Open source, 64-bit replacement for USEARCH with compression support

Velvet.description: Popular de Bruijn graph based, de novo genome assembler for short HTS reads

ViennaRNA.description: A suite of programs and C code library for the prediction and comparison of RNA secondary structures.

VirFinder.description: R package for identifying viral sequences from metagenomic data using sequence signatures

abawaca.description: PCA-based binner of assembled reads. Takes lrn files as input

anvio.description: A large suite of bioinformatic tools for analyzing 'omic data.

betapart.description: R package for partitioning beta diversity into turnover and nestedness components

edgeR.description: R package for differential expression analysis of digital gene expression data. Implements a range of statistical methodology based on the negative binomial distributions, including empirical Bayes estimation, exact tests, generalized linear models and quasi-likelihood tests

edirect.description: A toolkit for accessing all of NCBI's databases via the command line

geo-omics.description: A library of Python and Perl programs for various tasks. Most scripts perform some function on data after it's processed.

iRep.description: Program to calculate Index or Replication

indicspecies.description: R package with functions to assess the strength and statistical significance of the relationship between species occurrence/abundance and groups of sites. Also includes functions to measure species niche breadth using resource categories

labdsv.description: R package with a variety of ordination and community analyses useful in analysis of data sets in community ecology. Includes many of the common ordination methods, with graphical routines to facilitate their interpretation, as well as several novel analyses

metagenomeSeq.description: For determining features (be it Operational Taxanomic Unit (OTU), species, etc.) that are differentially abundant between two or more groups of multiple samples. metagenomeSeq is designed to address the effects of both normalization and under-sampling of microbial communities on disease association detection and the testing of feature correlations

mugsy.description: Multiple whole genome aligner that aligns draft genomes to each other

pplacer.description: Places query sequences on a phylogenetic tree to quickly determine their phylogeny. Visualization options available with guppy

seq-annot.description: Python package of tools to facilitate annotation and comparison of genomes and metagenomes

seq-qc.description: Python package of tools for performing various quality control tasks on sequencing reads

sickle.description: A windowed adaptive trimmer for FASTQ files

snpEff.description: Annotates and predicts the effects of genetic variants such as amino acid changes

sourmash.description: A command-line tool and Python library for computing MinHash sketches from DNA sequences, comparing them to each other, and plotting the results. Allows for quick and accurate estimation of sequence similarity between very large datasets

subread.description: High-performance aligners for aligning and counting alignments of DNA and RNA reads. Also contains tools for identifying variants and indels in aligned sequences

tRNAscan-SE.description: Makes use of covariance models to annotate tRNA genes in genomes.

vegan.description: R package providing tools for descriptive community ecology. It has most basic functions of diversity analysis, community ordination and dissimilarity analysis
